definition: Altair (star)/Cowherd of the folk tale Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
Altair (star)/Cowherd of the folk tale Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女
to sack the home and lead off the cattle (proverb)/to strip of everything
Pharbitis, genus of herbaceous plants including Morning glory 牽牛|牵牛 (Pharbitis nil)

sentences.english: It is said that the Herd-boy and Waving-girl can meet only on that evening every year.
sentences.chinese: 传说，牵牛和织女每年只有在在这个时候才能想见。

sentences.english: The morning glory climbs the trunk with its tendril .
sentences.chinese: 牵牛花用卷须攀着树干。

sentences.english: There is Our love which winds through days like morning glories.
sentences.chinese: 有我们的爱情像牵牛花天风。

sentences.english: Morning Glory clouds are a specific and more unusual type of roll clouds.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛花云是滚轴云中比较独特而少见的一种。

sentences.english: Altair is not as bright as Vega and Deneb.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛星与织女和天津四相比，光亮度还是略为逊色。

sentences.english: The legend derives from the myth about Cowherd and Weaver Girl before Dang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 该传说是在唐以前牵牛织女神话的基型上衍化而成。

sentences.english: I discovered the morning glory had been in bloom.
sentences.chinese: 我发现了已经开了的牵牛花。

sentences.english: Morning-glories upfold their flowers by noon.
sentences.chinese: 牵牛花在中午时就合上了。

sentences.english: Weedy morning-glory vines overran the rainforest canopy.
sentences.chinese: 蔓生的牵牛花藤越过了雨林的天蓬，疯长开去。

sentences.english: It is a custom for Chinese to watch the Altair and Vega on the chairs.
sentences.chinese: 七夕节坐着仰望牵牛星和织女星是中国人的一个习俗。

definition: yellow flower (cosmetic powder used on women's forehead in former times)
Chinese peony (Paeonia lactiflora)/common herbaceous peony/peony used in TCM
to put one's hand to the plow
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
